metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7869 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
GnuTLS before 2017-02-20 has an out-of-bounds write caused by an integer overflow and heap-based buffer overflow related to the cdk_pkt_read function in opencdk/read-packet.c. This issue (which is a subset of the vendor's GNUTLS-SA-2017-3 report) is fixed in 3.5.10.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.5.8-5ubuntu1
libgnutls-dane0 - 3.5.8-5ubuntu1
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.5.8-5ubuntu1
libgnutls30 - 3.5.8-5ubuntu1
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.5.8-5ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.5.8-5ubuntu1').
